name: Virginia Beach Days Inn at the Beach

reviews.text: I have vacationed in VA Beach for over 20 years and have stayed at a variety of hotels on the beach. This particular Days Inn is usually our choice for a last minute trip b/c it is cheaper and sometimes one of the few places with vacancies when you book last minute. I was shocked to find that the hotel had been updated since we last stayed there. We stayed two years ago, and the hotel was looking really bad. I was actually a little nervous this time and hoping it had not become even more run down. But I was very pleased to find completely renovated rooms with pillow-top mattresses, new carpet, new linens, paint, etc. The TV remote was even brand new. They have really made a lot of improvements to the place including adding another hot tub by the pool and a water fall, as well as lots of tropical vegetation in the pool area. The hotel was much cleaner than our previous stays and staff were more friendly. The outside of the hotel could use some touch-ups but I'm not sure how much could be done to improve the exterior appearance of the hotel.
reviews.title: Much Improved

likes.disliked: — too many kids in the pool to enjoy swimming

reviews.text: We would stay there again. We pre-paid and got a room with a pool view for $127/night. Our room was even ready at 11am when we arrived. They've added a coffee/smoothie bar at the corner shop under the hotel which was really nicely done and convenient. They've also added an internet cafe and a fitness room, although both of those left a lot to be desired.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

likes.disliked: — Got a smokers room in spite of reserving non. All rooms booked, so stuck with it.

reviews.text: Be aware, the construction of condos accross from the hotel has just begun and by next summer the unobstructed ocean view from the hotel will definately be obstructed by a massive condo complex.
reviews.title: Good room and value
